titleStmt.title: A hymn to Enki for I&c;me-Dagan -- an English prose translation

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

sourceDesc.p: Sources are listed in the header of the composite text

body.p: The task of &X;&X; its marshes, of &X;&X; the great arable lands and the fields, of &X;&X; the fruit orchards that bear pure &X;&X;, of &X;&X; food and drink for the Anuna gods -- all this was bestowed on him by Father Enlil and the great mother Ninlil.

August Nibru! No deity excels like your lord and lady! They are powerful princes; they are brilliantly revealed deities. No deity excels like Enlil or Ninlil! They are powerful princes; they are lords who can decide destinies. In your midst they have given divine powers to King Enki. Nibru, your holy songs are exceptionally precious, surpassing all praise! I, I&c;me-Dagan, have placed them in everyone's mouths for all time.
